title: Commerce Writer, Vogue Beauty
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
Beauty Commerce Writer
Conde Nast is seeking a Beauty Commerce Writer to craft unique and compelling shopping-focused beauty content for Vogue.
The ideal candidate will be passionate about the beauty industry from a shopping lens and possess a strong background in both writing and the beauty market space. The candidate should be comfortable writing reviews, interviewing experts, and be able to skillfully position a story to attract readers and retain loyal audiences while maintaining the *Vogue* standard and voice by providing thoughtful, well-researched information that aids in decision-making.
The Beauty Commerce Writer should be comfortable optimizing all shopping content, using best practices for affiliate and SEO. The ideal candidate should also be capable of analyzing traffic data and conversion results to inform future stories, as well as brainstorming new ways to engage our audience around shopping-driven stories on all our digital platforms, including social, newsletter, and storefront. The candidate should have a strong editorial eye and taste level with a passion for curation and discovery. This role reports into *Vogue’s* Senior Beauty Shopping Writer.* Pitch, write, update, and optimize an average of 8 stories weekly, working with the *Vogue* Shopping team to ensure that all content & product recommendations feel modern and on-brand.
* Test products and manage the sourcing of relevant reviews and creative assets (photos, videos, etc.) from a wider network of contributors
* Help with beauty & wellness market optimizations on Vogue.com and across platforms
* Work with the Senior Beauty Shopping Writer and Senior Shopping Editor to manage and execute a long-term shopping editorial calendar to feature and stay ahead on seasonal shopping content
* Assist in managing beauty market samples, including but not limited to incoming packages in the beauty closet, product call-ins for shoots, and miscellaneous testing
* Identify and help plan around editorial categories, SEO keywords, seasonal tent poles, and personal narratives that present a commerce opportunity for *Vogue*, studying purchasing data, tracking site analytics, and performing competitive analysis of comparable sites
* Identify new shopping opportunities including trending products and industry trends
* Coordinate closely with the commerce, audience development, and editorial teams to share data and best practices that can inform editorial decision making.
* Drive a clear editorial point of view for product and shopping recommendations appealing to the *Vogue* reader.
* Stay abreast of beauty market trends, industry innovations, product launches etc, and feed ideas, with a POV, back to the wider editorial and commerce teams


Skills & Qualifications* A minimum of two years writing or editing commerce/affiliate content at a digital property, as well as a strong command of SEO best practices
* Impeccable editorial judgment and journalistic integrity
* An ability to write conversationally with authority and accuracy while capturing *Vogue’s* voice
* Experience in managing product sourcing logistics at a digital property (either editorial or commerce)
* A finger to the pulse on the shopping content that’s popular on social media and the beauty industry at large
* Ability to analyze performance across different verticals, product categories, retailers, and content types
* Strong organizational skills, a self-directed work style, and polished communication skills
* A self-starter who relishes the opportunity to directly accelerate the growth of Condé Nast commerce business


This is a guild position.
The expected base salary range for this position is from $70,000-$93,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including but not limited to relevant skills, training, experience, and education.
In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates may also be eligible to receive discretionary bonus compensation.
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.*Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.*

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**About Kushner Real Estate Group**

Founded in 1979 and headquartered in Jersey City, NJ, KRE Group is a full-service real estate investment and management company with properties in New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. The KRE multi-family portfolio exceeds 9,000 existing apartments, with an additional 7,000 in various stages of approval and construction. The company also owns and manages more than 6,000,000 square feet of office, warehouse, and retail space. For more information, visit the company’s website at www.thekregroup.com.

Under the direction of the Chief Financial Officer and Director of Human Resources, the successful hire will perform the following:

**DEPARTMENTAL SUPPORT & ADMINISTRATION**

***Human Resources*** 

* Maintain accuracy within HR database with employee information and necessary documentation, including but not limited to status changes such as new hires, rehires, terminations, and leaves of absence.
* Generate regular reports on HR metrics in support of relevant HR activities (e.g., turnover rates, length of service, etc.)
* Create ad hoc reports and manipulate data, as needed, in an accurate and concise manner.
* Support external queries and requests related to the HR Department.
* Act as a go-to HR professional for day-to-day employee questions and respond to employees in a timely and accurate manner ensuring complete follow-through.
* Organize and maintain personnel records.
* Onboard new employees, ensuring they receive timely and accurate instruction regarding their employment and benefit options.
* Offboard terminated employees, in accordance with standard internal procedures.
* Organize and manage the annual Open Enrollment process; advise employees regarding benefit plan coverage and eligibility for benefits.
* Provide support with enrollment, orientation, and termination of benefits.
* Track and report on Leave of Absences (LOAs).
* Review discrepancy reports from the medical carriers when issues arise between HRIS and carrier record-keeping systems.
* Perform other duties as required.

***Accounting*** 

* Assist the Accounting team with administrative tasks such as tracking and compiling information.
* Create and maintain filing systems, both electronic and physical.
* Responsible for preparation and distribution of confidential documents and reports.
* Prepare and distribute various reports.
* Research and collect information.
* Perform ad hoc duties as required.

***Reception***

* Provide information and resources by identifying visitors’ needs.
* Serve visitors by greeting, welcoming, and directing them appropriately.
* Notify relevant parties when visitors arrive.
* Answer a multiple line phone system, manage calls by routing them to the proper extensions and/or taking messages.
* Accept deliveries and incoming mail, organize distribution to the correct recipients, ensuring timely delivery.
* Manage outgoing mail and packages for pick up.
* Manage and maintain inventory for office supplies, snacks, and beverages.
* Maintain ethical, professional, and courteous relations with all visitors.
* Maintain a clean and professional reception lobby area.
* Provide general administrative or clerical support as needed.
* Exhibit a professional appearance.
* Maintain communications with relief Receptionist.
* Maintain office safety and security by following relevant procedures.
* Perform other duties as required.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* 2+ years of administrative experience with proficiency in Microsoft Office.
* Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and excellent phone etiquette.
* Experience with multi-line phone systems and front desk operations preferred.
* Previous Human Resources experience is advantageous.
* Proven ability providing exceptional customer service.

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US.

The KRE Group conducts background checks and MVR checks (if applicable) as a condition of employment.

*EOE/AA Employer/Vets/Disability*

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Case Manager - $36,076 - $45.095k
description:
Our client, a reputable non-profit organization in NYC has multiple openings for Case Manager Positions.

**Schedule:** Sunday through Thursday 9:00 am to 5:00 pm

**Salary Range:** $36,076 - $45,095

**Roles, Responsibilities and Essential Duties**

* Serve as case manager for homeless adults, with a goal of placing them in permanent housing
* Perform intake, assessment, service planning, advocacy, referral and escort services
* Provide case management; identify short and long-term client centered goals and help clients achieve them, including linkages to community programs such as medical, psychiatric and drug treatment services.
* Utilize evidence-based practices such as person- centered planning and motivational interviewing.
* Maintain case records with documentation of services provided and outcomes, according to specific program procedures. Responsible for case notes and service plans using an electronic database
* Assist clients in applying for, receiving and maintaining entitlements
* Accompany clients on visits to doctors, entitlement offices or other community services as needed
* Serve as liaison between other service providers and community resources
* Encourage engagement and participation among resistant clients
* Participate in weekly staff meetings, case conferences, training programs and supervision meetings
* Assist with the design, planning, and implementation of group activities and events
* Facilitate groups, collaborate with harm reduction specialists and housing specialists

**Qualifications/Educational Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred, but not required
* Experience working with homeless adults preferred
* Experience working with individuals diagnosed with severe and persistent mental illness, substance abuse and/or co-occurring disorders preferred
* Prior case management experience preferred
* Experience in homeless outreach, transitional or supportive housing a plus
* Bilingual (English and Spanish) preferred

**Skills, Knowledge and Abilities**

* Understanding of housing first model
* Understanding of severe and persistent mental illness
* Understanding of harm reduction and trauma informed care
* Understanding of or willingness to learn evidence based practices
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Strong written and verbal skills
* Team player

**Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should be**:

* Proficient in Microsoft Outlook and Excel
* Able to use or learn computer databases such as AWARDS, CARES, Paycom

**Physical Requirements**

* Some walking and travel to escort clients to various appointments throughout the city
* Occasional visits to hospital emergency rooms

**Work Environment**

* Mostly indoor office, occasionally working in a kitchen setting during groups
* Regular visits to client living spaces also required

Pay: $36,076.00 - $45,095.00 per year

title: Community Mental Health Educator
description:
**Summary:**

Long Island Crisis Center provides 24/7, free, high quality, confidential, and non-judgmental programs and services to support and empower Long Islanders at critical times in their lives. Our highly regarded Community Education program delivers workshops to both students and professional staff in middle schools and high schools in Nassau and western Suffolk County.

We are seeking an energetic, dynamic Community Mental Health Educator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be able to deliver these workshops to a wide array of audiences as well as assist with our 988 Counselor training program.

title: Experienced No-fault arbitration / litigation paralegal
company: Law Office of Olga Sklyut PC
description:
**WE WILL NOT CONSIDER APPLICANTS WITHOUT NO-FAULT ARBITRATION/LITIGATION EXPERIENCE.**

**Arbitration/Litigation Paralegal** 

A well-established Sheepshead Bay-based law firm specializing in legal services for medical providers in the No-Fault insurance sector is seeking an Arbitration/Litigation Paralegal. This role involves supporting attorneys with cases filed in AAA and state courts

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Review and manage both new and ongoing legal cases.
* Update and maintain the case management system with relevant information.
* Draft legal documents, including correspondence and notices.
* Communicate with clients to gather necessary records and information.
* Schedule and manage court appearances, dates, and conferences.
* Collaborate with team members while also working independently to complete tasks.
* Prepare and manage files for arbitration, assisting with case management.
* Coordinate with external and internal teams, including clients, medical offices, billing companies, and attorneys.
* Assist in filing judgments, enforcing arbitration awards, and working with a Marshal to enforce judgments.
* Take on additional tasks as needed to support the firm’s operations and case management needs.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 1-2 years of experience working on no-fault arbitration and litigation cases.
* Strong understanding of the litigation and arbitration process
* Strong familiarity with No-Fault insurance and Worker’s Compensation Fee Schedule

**Skills Required:**

* Proficient in drafting formal and effective correspondence.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* High attention to detail with strong organizational skills.
* Ability to meet strict deadlines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficiency with computer software, including Adobe Acrobat, MS Word, and MS Excel.

**Expectations:**

* Handle confidential information with the highest level of care and professionalism.
* Maintain and promote a collaborative work environment.
* Actively seek to understand and improve the firm’s internal processes.

**Salary:** Commensurate with experience.

We are looking for motivated and responsible individuals with relevant experience who are eager to grow their careers in a dynamic legal environment. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

title: Director of Child Care Center
company: A Step Ahead Learning Academy, LLC
description:
Job Summary:

As the Center Director, you will oversee the day to day operations of our childcare center while demonstrating exceptional professional conduct and consideration for the educational development, safety and welfare of the children and staff.

Responsibilities of position include but are not limited to:

* Ensure compliance with safety standards of the children and staff
* Manage local and state licensing regulations and ensure state compliance and record keeping
* Manage staff scheduling to meet compliance standards
* Supervise and assist staff in enriching early childhood curriculum
* Ensuring adherence to all requirements of N.J.A.C. Manual of Requirements for Child Care Centers including renewal of State Child Care License
* Ensuring staff and parent adherence to all center policies and procedures outlined in Parent and Employee Handbooks
* Creating a positive rapport with all staff members through daily interactions
* Scheduling, supervising, observing, evaluating, and mentoring staff of approximately 13 employees
* Arranging staff to ensure ratios are being met at all times dismissing part-time staff when no longer needed
* Coordinate annual registration process
* Approving/denying staff requests for time off and scheduling appropriate coverage
* Receiving staff sick-calls and arranging emergency coverage
* Conducting and documenting daily classroom observation logs to aid in compiling monthly classroom meeting agendas
* Planning and conducting monthly staff room meetings and annual staff training workshops
* Recruiting, interviewing, and hiring applicants and assisting in training new staff members
* Completing initial and annual staff evaluation forms/ meetings
* Regularly monitor each classroom and provide ongoing feedback to teachers
* Planning weekly academic calendar themes/topics of focus to create monthly classroom calendars
* Approving and creating individual class monthly calendars
* Approving individual class weekly lesson plans
* Ensuring the implementation of a developmentally appropriate curriculum in all classrooms
* Coordinating special events and fundraisers
* Planning and overseeing summer camp program
* Arranging and advertising continuing education opportunities for staff
* Keeping craft supply inventory and ordering supplies
* Provide effective tours to potential families to drive enrollment
* Creating a positive rapport with all parents through daily interactions
* Assist the business owner with payroll processing while ensuring the accuracy of time keeping systems
* Employee engagement/recognition
* Onboarding and offboarding of new employees
* Oversee the purchasing of supplies and parent billings and collections
* Emailing notifications to parents and maintaining regular correspondence
* Addressing and documenting any concerns or incidents regarding children, parents, and/or staff
* Arranging and supervising parent/teacher meetings and providing parents with guidance and resources when necessary
* Reviewing and approving all forms to parents
* Closing center at day's end
* Must meet applicable state Director Certification requirements
* College degree in Early Childhood Education preferred
* Educational leadership or a related field
* 2+ years experience supervising staff in a child care center or related field
* Computer proficiency wit Microsoft Applications
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
* Exceptional time management and organizational skills
* Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment
* Solid business acumen, management, analytical, and problem thinking skills
* Ability and willingness to work a flexible Full Time schedule that may include weekends and holidays

title: Merchandiser
description:
**OVERVIEW:**



This role exists to help shape the North America Commercial function, maintaining best in class merchandising and buying standards and determining the best product for the market.


*Please note t**his* *is a hybrid* *role partially based in our New York City office. All candidates must be local or willing to relocate. You must also be authorized to work in the United States**.*


**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:**


**Responsible For:**


* Strategic assortment building and investing for the NAM market based on hindsights, completive analysis and company targets
* Developing and maintaining relationships with relevant stakeholders and functions across the NAM region and global
* Managing inventory flows to support the execution of monthly Open-to-Buy objectives and inputs
* Management and analysis of selling trends, reorder process within specific distribution center data
* Monitor warehouse stock flow delivery timing
* Analysis of competitive landscape and market trends
* Site management – monitor eComm execution of product storytelling on site
* Collaborating with relevant stakeholders for product launches, marketing pushes and day to day needs
* Developing excel based tools to better track imagery, Shopify data and general inventory for NAM region


**Accountable For:**


* Identifying white space opportunity and prescribing product fit for NAM consumer
* Increase profitability and satisfaction of market needs
* Data reporting and analysis of competitive market trends
* Increase sales performance


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED:**


**Essential Skills & Experience:**


* 3-5 years merchandising experience
* Skilled in Excel and building PowerPoint decks
* Clear and concise presentation skills
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* High attention to detail and time management
* Experience in people management a plus


**ABOUT US.**



We're here to unite the conditioning community. We believe that putting the sweat in today, prepares us for tomorrow. So, we give people the tools they need to reach further, go faster, be stronger. We celebrate those who show up – for themselves – to be their physical or mental best, whatever that means for them. It's what we want for our community, and our team. A team that's growing rapidly around the world. A collective of talented individuals working together to invent Gymshark's future. Our plans are ambitious, and we're looking for people who want to join us for the ride – our growth will be your growth.


**THE PERKS.**



At Gymshark we believe in the importance of investing in our employees through their physical, mental, and financial health along with being able to provide some fun and inclusive perks along the way.


**This role has a salary range between $80,000-$90,000. The base pay offered is based on market, experience, and skills.**



Part of our compensation package includes a discretionary annual company performance bonus. We are also able to offer our employees and their families a comprehensive medical, dental, and vision package. Gymshark provides company paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, and our Sharks also receive a generous 401K match to help them save for their retirement.



Gymshark will continue to support our employees' overall wellbeing through several perks including 20 days of paid time off (plus your birthday), 11 holidays, transportation allowance, wellbeing program, and a 50% discount on all Gymshark items. We hope you consider joining our growing family in New York City.


* *All benefits are non-contractual, and Gymshark may amend, terminate, or enhance the benefits provided you and our other employees from time to time as it deems appropriate.*


**BELONGING AT GYMSHARK.**



Our mission is to be a place where everyone belongs. We're an equal opportunities employer, and for us that means we always strive to be as inclusive as possible in all aspects of employment, right from your application. We're committed to finding reasonable adjustments\\* for candidates with specific needs or have a disability during our recruitment process, and all applicants will be considered fairly and equally. We do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. \\*If you'd like to request a reasonable adjustment please email peopleteamusa@gymshark.com.

title: Facultative Property Team Lead
description:
Facultative Property Team Lead
**Company**  

Munich Re America
  

**Location**  

New York , United States


We will consider candidates in our Chicago or NYC offices.

  

We’re adding to our diverse team of experts and are looking to hire those who are committed to building a culture that enables the creation of innovative solutions for our business units and clients. We will consider a range of experience for this role and the offer will be commensurate with that.

 **The Company**

  

As a member of Munich Re's US operations, we offer the financial strength and stability that comes with being part of the world's preeminent insurance and reinsurance brand. Our risk experts work together to assemble the right mix of products and services to help our clients stay competitive – from traditional reinsurance coverages, to niche and specialty reinsurance and insurance products.

  

Munich Re Facultative and Corporate (MR F&C) was created to bundle Munich Re’s facultative and corporate business into one global unit. By aligning our single risk business in one unified team we better position Munich Re to provide a holistic suite of products and services that meet the growing demands of our clients and broker partners.

 **The Opportunity**

  

In this role, the Facultative Property Underwriting Team Lead will lead a team of underwriters that is part of the Global Facultative & Corporate Division (MRF&C) to achieve business unit goals. They will be accountable for a book of business by managing the underwriting of profitable business, achieving the goals as set forth in the business plan and managing, developing and retaining talent.

 **Key Responsibilities of this position include:**

* Manage the underwriting process within the Individual Certificate portfolio in line with F&Cs risk appetite, efficiency goals and market strategy to achieve a balanced, well-diversified and profitable portfolio in all market cycles as well as underwriting and pricing integrity of the portfolio.
* Establish clear performance and professional development goals and milestones for all employees. Mentor underwriters and support the development of talent across the MR Group.
* Work with key brokers and cedants to grow the property individual certificate portfolio in a profitable way.
* Delegate underwriting authority to staff, and work with Referral Underwriting Team to ensure underwriters have a clear understanding of underwriting and pricing guidelines and are proficient in the use of all applicable underwriting and pricing tools.
* Ensure underwriting practices are consistent with MR Group, MR US P&C and MR F&C guidelines, Best Practices and underwriting strategies. Identify deficiencies in underwriting, implement corrective actions and provide guidance/training for the development of underwriters.
* Take the lead in creating solutions and resolving problems involving other functional units such as Treaty, Client Management, Underwriting Support, Pricing, etc.
* Provide insight into the quantitative and qualitative analyses of results for F&C NA.
* Work with Division management to develop a Business Plan for Individual Certificate and a Prospect List of Property Individual Certificate cedants as well as initiatives to ensure future success of F&C.
* This position may also have underwriting responsibility for key accounts as assigned and agreed to with the Head of Property Fac as appropriate.

 **Qualifications:**

* BS/BA preferred, advanced degree a pls. CPCU, ARe designations preferred
* 10+ years industry experience, 7+ in reinsurance. Primary insurance experience and knowledge of program business is a plus.
* Underwriting expert level knowledge of applicable Property Lines of Business
* High level of actuarial understanding and demonstrated competency using MRAm pricing tools
* High level of reinsurance contract (terminology) understanding and ability to develop alternative clauses where necessary
* Experience in managing people, leading cross-functional projects plus strong interpersonal and social skills, solid negotiation, oral and written communication skills, understanding of accounting, finance and actuarial concepts.
* Facultative Individual Certificate and Facultative Program experience is preferred.
* Experience working with Brokers is required.
* In-depth knowledge of the US insurance and reinsurance markets. Ability to develop and execute plans and to provide strategic direction to the development and achievement of unit goals
* Ability to explain complex transaction structures to both technical and non-technical audiences;
* Required to travel to branch offices and for audits and client and broker visits (approx. 25% of time)

  

We will consider candidates in our Chicago or NYC offices. The salary range posted below applies to the Company's NYC location.

  

The base salary range anticipated for this position is $246,500 - $361,500plus opportunity for company bonus based upon a percentage of eligible pay. In addition, the company makes available a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, 401k match, retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).

  



The salary estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for candidates hired in this position in NYC. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have and comparison to other employees already in this role. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the range.

  



At Munich Re, we see Diversity, Equity and Inclusion as a solution to the challenges and opportunities all around us. Our goal is to foster an inclusive culture and build a workforce that reflects the customers we serve and the communities in which we live and work. We strive to provide a workplace where all of our colleagues feel respected, valued and empowered to achieve their very best every day. We recruit and develop talent with a focus on providing our customers the most innovative products and services.

  

We are an equal opportunity employer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Apply now!

title: Director, Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
**Overview /Objective**



The Financial Planning and Analysis team manages companywide budgeting and forecasting. This includes operational costs, as well as capital and cash planning.



This is an extremely exciting opportunity to drive future growth at the National Football League and is a great position for anyone that is interested in the business of sports and wants to learn in an extremely fast paced and dynamic environment.



The Director will report to the VP of Financial Planning and Analysis and will lead multiple companywide financial and operational planning cycles.


**Responsibilities**


* Lead roll-up of consolidated Companywide financial statements on a global basis
* Lead day-to-day management of Company's financial planning system
* Generate and automate weekly, monthly and quarterly financial reports
* Directly manage and develop Senior Coordinator currently on the team
* Assist in quarterly business reviews by identifying key business drivers and trends that can be used to drive decision making across the Company
* Support the building and management of annual operating plan, quarterly and real-time forecasts, as well as deliverables for senior leaders


**Required Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree from an accredited university
* Minimum 10 years of work experience relating to budgeting, forecasting, and analytics
* Strong skills in Excel and PowerPoint


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience building and managing financial models
* Experience working with financial planning software and tools
* Experience with sports media & entertainment industry
* Know how to present financial results and projections in a way that helps senior management


**Other Key Attributes / Characteristics**


* Proven leader in achieving objectives and setting direction for a team
* Strong communication and presentation skills
* Ability to operate successfully in a matrixed organization
* Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to multi-task meeting all deadlines and grasping new concepts quickly


**Physical Demands**


* N/A


**Travel**


* Minimal travel


**Salary / Pay Range**



This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.


**Terms / Expected Hours of Work**


* NFL employees are required to work 40 hours per week. This position may require additional hours.

*The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.*


*The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.*

title: Warehouse Clerk
description:
**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Includes but not limited to the following: Pick/Pack, Workflow, Put Away, Tag, Box

· Verify the accuracy of tags supplied.

· Interfile work bags in order/line sequence within each batch.

· Ability to communicate effectively with various stations to coordinate receipt of product.

· Ability to verify quantity delivered matches on work bag.

· Inspect shipments for damage.

· Report damages or shortages to the appropriate person.

· Match shipments to their associated purchase orders and enter data on paperwork.

· Record data in company databases.

· Must be able to Multitask.

**Qualifications**

Detail oriented, some PC knowledge, ability to work with warehouse systems, good communication and follow up skills.

**Education**

High School

**Computer skills**

Individual must be able to enter data into warehouse systems.

**Language Skills**

Ability to respond to common inquiries from superiors or other team members. Good verbal communication skills required. It is preferable if individual is bilingual (English- Spanish) but not a must.

**Physical Demands**

The employee is required to be on their feet several hours throughout the day. The employee is required to stand; climb and stoop. The employee must regularly lift and or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and or move up to 25 pounds.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Pay: $15.13 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please provide availability for an interview.

Work Location: In person

title: Studio Associate
description:
**Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility**
At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.

We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we're providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
Lucid is building a brand. A luxury brand centered around sustainability and the human experience. We're looking for enthusiastic and conscientious **Studio Associates** to build Lucid with us.



As a **Studio Associate** in a Lucid studio your primary responsibility will be to deliver exceptional, personalized, customer interactions.



You are a motivated and engaging quick learner with a desire to provide memorable and enjoyable customer experiences.



To be successful in this role you should be an incredible communicator and conversationist with the ability to recognize subtle social cues. You will be eager to support the studio team with ad hoc tasks where required and consistently act as a brand promotor and facilitate the customer journey.


**The Role:**


* Be a critical Lucid Ambassador; the first point of engagement guests will have with Lucid
* Welcome guests in an engaging, courteous and sincere manner
* Demonstrate excitement and create intrigue about Lucid products
* Needs Assessment: Effectively gauge customer needs through personalized interactions and insightful questioning.
* Pipeline Management: Maintain and build a robust customer pipeline through disciplined practices.
* CRM: Utilize Salesforce as CRM tool to track and manage customer interactions with consistent and timely engagement
* Conduct test drives and articulate desired points of interest ensuring an exceptional experience while driving Lucid vehicles.
* Competitive landscape: Take initiative to understand competitor models and packages in order to educate customer on why Lucid
* Effectively communicate the benefits of Lucid products and being a member of the Lucid community
* Gauge guests' requirements and interests to deliver a personalized and relevant interaction
* Be responsible for lead capture and progression of guests through initial part of the Lucid journey
* Manage and overcome customer challenges in a cordial and calm manner
* Ensure all studio assets are presentable and consistent with the Lucid brand image
* Keep a keen eye on any pain points or bottlenecks observed during daily studio operations, think creatively and offer improvement suggestions
* Remain available for ad-hoc activities to improve studio operations and customer experiences
* Support local marketing initiatives and events to build brand awareness
* Maintain a continuing desire to learn and develop to progress your career with Lucid Motors
* Assist with daily operations as needed


**Qualifications**


* Completed, or working towards, Bachelor's degree or equivalent is preferred.
* Exceptional people skills including strong oral and written communication, empathy and active listening ability.
* Ability to deliver outstanding customer experiences in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
* Conscientious, responsible and reliable.
* Curiosity and passion about electric vehicles and the premium vehicle market and competitive landscape
* Comfortable operating in ambiguous retail environment
* Physical requirements include the ability to twist, bend, squat, reach, and stand for extended periods of time with or without reasonable accommodation.
* Familiarity with CRM tools a plus
* Flexible availability including extended holiday mall hours, holidays and weekends
* Valid driver's license with no suspensions within the past year
* Second language in Arabic or Farsi advantageous.


By Submitting your application, you understand and agree that your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.



**To all recruitment agencies**: *Lucid Motors* ***does not*** *accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.*
company_description: Lucid's a luxury mobility company re-imagining what a car can be. We inspire the adoption of sustainable transportation by creating captivating electric vehicles centered around the human experience.

title: Clinic Manager
description:
The Clinic Manager partners with both clinical and non-clinical staff to ensure seamless healthcare delivery at our Biograph clinic in New York City, NY. This role involves overseeing all administrative and operational functions that influence medical services at the clinic, ensuring efficiency and excellence. Additionally, the Clinic Manager collaborates closely with the clinic's Medical Director and the Biograph management team in strategic planning and execution, guaranteeing the highest quality of care for all patients.

  


**COMP | PERKS | BENEFITS**


* $80,000 - $120,000 Annually
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance (100% covered)
* 401(k)
* Paid maternity / paternity leave
* Unlimited PTO
* Biograph Membership

  


**WHAT YOU WILL DO**


* Manage day to day clinic operations ensuring a smooth and efficient workflow. Develop and implement policies and procedures to improve operational efficiency and patient care
* Monitor and maintain clinic equipment and supplies, ensuring they are properly stocked and functioning
* Partner with the operations team to scale the San Mateo clinic capacity while maintaining high level of service
* Recruit, train, and supervise clinic staff and administrative personnel.
* Conduct performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback and implement professional development plans
* Develop and manage the clinic's budget, ensuring financial targets are met. Monitor billing and collections processes
* Analyze financial reports and implement cost-control measures as needed
* Collaborate with Membership Director to support patients by providing high-touch, white-glove service, prepare patient schedules, stocking suites for appointments, coordinating with the clinic team to ensure smooth appointments, and manage patient feedback and resolve issues promptly
* Ensure compliance with healthcare regulatory requirements, accreditation standards, and company policies. Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance
* Perform any additional assigned tasks / ad hoc projects

  


**WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE**


* 3-5 years clinic or practice management experience preferred
* Bachelor's degree required
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively communicate with Physicians, other medical professionals, office personnel employees and patients
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Computer literacy and knowledge of relevant health care and administrative software (GSuite, Airtable, EHR)
* Financial acumen and experience with budgeting and financial management
* Strong knowledge of healthcare regulations, accreditation standards, and best practices
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and and work effectively in a fast-paced environment
* Agile, flexible and resourceful
* Comfortable working independently and owning projects, defining timelines and deliverables


Biograph is the world's most advanced healthcare technology company focused on helping individuals live healthier and longer. Our approach, the Biograph Method, leverages state-of-the-art technology and a world-class multidisciplinary team of providers to unlock unique personalized insights for our members. All of this is delivered in our world class facilities where we provide an unparalleled luxury experience.



We aim to disrupt the traditional healthcare system by shifting focus to proactive health optimization. We can't sit idle while millions of people suffer from preventable disease. Be a major part of the story behind one of the most ambitious startups, and work with a team of people who are on a mission to drive meaningful advances in healthspan and lifespan.

title: General Manager - Macy's Shop, Herald Square
description:
Our vision is to establish HUGO BOSS as the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide and to be one of the top 100 global brands. At HUGO BOSS, we work as a team to apply our knowledge, skills and experience together and create a diversity of ideas and solutions. What unites us? We love fashion, we change fashion!

  

At HUGO BOSS, you have the opportunity to contribute your personality, ideas and creativity — because only when we break new ground together can we create something unique. Become part of our team of more than 17.000 employees worldwide and shape your future at HUGO BOSS!

  

Convey a positive impression of HUGO BOSS to the marketplace by delivering an exceptional shopping experience, showcasing the brand through exciting merchandise presentations and executing operational strategies resulting in positive operating profits.

 **What you can expect:**

***Sales and Profitability Targets:***


* Achieve positive results in top line sales, profit and loss management and inventory control
* Achieve financial success through improvement of measurable statistics that positively impact the store performance.
* Establish a goal oriented selling culture that focuses on relationship selling, building a client base and exceptional service.

Utilize effective communication skills in training and developing staff, delivering exceptional service to customers, driving business with the merchant group and general problem solving.  
* 

***Team Management & Development:***


* Exceptional leadership and management skills and the ability to motivate, develop and inspire a team while creating a highly empowered organization
* Monitor performance, provide direction, and take corrective action when needed.
* Actively recruit all level candidates.
* Hire, train and motivate a qualified sales team that effectively represents and communicates Hugo Boss to our customers.
* Provide specific development for the store leadership team and supervisor by assigning accountabilities and training with consistent follow-up and feedback.
* Perform annual performance evaluations with quarterly review of employee goals.

  

  

***Customer Service Excellence:***


* Cultivate a relationship with the community via personal involvement, PR events and advertising opportunities.
* Oversee the development of clientele by leading by example in the ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, produce strong results from proactive outreach and the development of a personal business trade.
* Development of business driving initiatives that build a repeat business or that attracts a new customer.
* Ensure each associate is actively utilizing their client book in order to generate increased sales through monthly client book reviews and evaluation of their outreach.
* Ensure all associates complete the sales training program.
* Model and supervise the selling environment, provide consistent coaching on sales training process in order to ensure the highest level of customer service and sales.

  




***Operational Excellence:***


* Perform and supervise store opening and closing procedures including counting register funds, completing bank deposits, opening and closing registers and securing facility.
* Conduct regular store meetings to ensure accurate and consistent communication with employees.
* Maintain payroll budget and weekly hours to ensure appropriate sales floor coverage by reviewing store schedule and adjusting as necessary to meet the needs of the business.
* Supervise operational responsibilities to ensure the timely and accurate processing of all markdowns, transfers, damages, shipping and receiving in order to maintain the integrity of the inventory.
* Oversee loss prevention policies and procedure to be 100% compliant.
* Knowledgeable in all Health & Safety policies and procedures.
* Ensure all documentation relating to Health & Safety are well recorded and maintained.
* Ensure standard operating procedures are executed and policies followed
* Ensure visual merchandising directives are implemented efficiently as per direction and visual standards are maintained at all times.

  



**Your profile:**

**Knowledge, Skill, Experience:**


* Professional sales development and exceptional interpersonal skills
* Strong leadership qualities and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels within the organization and client base.
* Ability to analyze selling reports, identify business trends and react quickly to the needs of the business
* Comfortable in making decisions and mediating conflict within a team-environment
* Excellent organizational, analytical, time management and leadership skills
* Proficient in windows-based software such as excel, word and outlook

  




**Physical Requirements:**


* Available to work store schedule, as needed, including evenings, weekend and holidays.
* Standing for extended period of time.
* Able to safely lift boxes up to 40 pounds.
* Comfortable climbing ladders.

  




**Qualifications:**


* College degree in related field preferred
* 5+ year’s management experience in a luxury goods or a comparable retail environment.

Experience operating a high volume and or overlooking multiple store locations.  
* 

**Your benefits:**

* Health and Wellness Benefits
* Earned Vacation and Sick time
* Company Paid Holidays
* Generous Employee Discount

  




The expected base salary range for this position is from $85k -$90k. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered.

  


#LI-MC1

  

We are a global company with our employees representative of the world at large. Our inclusive culture embraces each person’s authenticity and individuality. We are committed to equal employment opportunity. And we believe our equitable work environment helps unleash your full potential and inspires you to thrive.
company_description: We are a global company with our employees representative of the world at large. Our inclusive culture embraces each person’s authenticity and individuality.

title: Head of Data, AI and Automation Technologies
description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

**Job Description**
-------------------


The Head of Data, AI and Automation Technologies is responsible for defining and executing the technology teams data and AI strategy, in alignment with the companies strategic approach to data and AI. This requires a deep understanding of critical data needs across the technology organization, and expert knowledge in enabling the latest AI capabilities with a focus on technology specific and enterprise-wide use cases supporting business line priorities. Key to this role is ensuring the highest reliability of data infrastructure, data quality, and security for all data assets and use across the Bank. This role will work in a federated model, supporting and closely coordinating with CIOs and other Technology leaders, and the enterprise AI and Data Centers of Excellence.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Defining and executing on the technology strategies for AI, automation, and data strategies, in alignment with the enterprises strategic approach and COEs for data and AI, and working with Enterprise Architecture to define standards and policies, staying abreast of new developments (and vendors) in the space, and ensuring propagation/dissemination of information across the Technology organization
* Providing expertise and support to other technology teams responsible for execution working in a federated model to provide AI, automation, and data subject matter expertise to identify and deploy use cases
* Collaborating with CXOs to integrate data, AI and automation into the overall technology roadmap and outcome metrics
* Building a data and outcome oriented culture focused on successful execution across the technology team
* Leading AI technology horizon scanning, vendor engagement, and research initiatives, staying abreast of the latest advancements in AI technologies and methodologies; clearly communicate these insights across the technology team
* Guiding learning and development programs in this space and help position U.S. Bank as a leader in this space
* Delivering value through analytics and AI use cases
* Ensuring data availability, usage, data quality, and data security
* Managing a small team Data and AI specialists – providing guidance, mentorship and support to team members to foster their professional growth and ensure the success of early use cases in partnership with AI COE
* Executing appropriate governance across technology and in alignment with the enterprise risk framework and enterprise data governance processes
* Supporting identification and execution of cost optimization strategies derived from data and AI across the technology organization
* Working with cross-functional leadership in Technology risk, Security, Legal, second line risk to represent technology concerns and push adoption forward across the bank

**KEY CHARACTERISTICS**

* Highly motivated, strategic leader with a clear vision for how data and AI can drive value for the organization
* Proven progressive leadership experience in leading data science, end to end data lifecycle, machine learning and AI teams and programs in a cross-functional and multidisciplinary organization within complex context
* Proven experience and track record of delivering tangible results in large institutions
* Excellent communications skills, ability to advocate for change in a large, complex organization and understanding of the banking sector’s risk and security posture to understand what tradeoffs are appropriate to advocate for
* Exemplary influencing and change management skills, business acumen, and bias towards action
* Knowledge of regulatory frameworks related to AI (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
* Strong intellectual curiosity demonstrated ability to learn new content; externally grounded in market trends, competitive events
* Experienced innovator with proven ability to lead through ambiguity
* Proven ability to establish strong working relationships with executive and senior levels of business lines

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree required, Masters or higher preferred
* 10+ years of technology leadership experience
* Knowledge and practical application of agile strongly preferred
* Advanced leadership skills, including the ability to identify top talent, lead and motivate teams and demonstrate leadership and collaboration among peers
* Proven ability to Drive AI solutions to unlock automation
* Risk and controls experience
* Proven experience building a culture of equity and inclusion through ideas and people
* Excellent communication and proven ability to synthesize large amounts of date/information to present to executives
* Proven track record with managing change


If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.


**Benefits:**


Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

* Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
* Basic term and optional term life insurance
* Short-term and long-term disability
* Pregnancy disability and parental leave
* 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan
* Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
* Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities
* Adoption assistance
* Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

**EEO is the Law**


U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

**E-Verify**


U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.


The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, U.S. Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401(k) contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $208,505.00 - $245,300.00 - $269,830.00
U.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
Job postings typically remain open for approximately 20 days of the posting date listed above, however the job posting may be closed earlier should it be determined the position is no longer required due to business need. Job postings in areas with a high volume of applicants, such as customer service, contact center, and Financial Crimes investigations, remain open for approximately 5 days of the posting listed date.
company_description: U.S. Bancorp is the parent company of U.S. Bank National Association, the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States headquartered in Minneapolis.

title: Administrative Assistant (Ad Tech)
description:
Kargo creates breakthrough cross-screen ad experiences for the world's leading brands and publishers. Everyday, our 600+ employees bring the power of their creativity and diversity to radically raising the bar on what mobile, CTV, AI, social, and eCommerce can do to wow consumers and build businesses. Now 20 years strong, Kargo has offices in NYC, Chicago, Austin, LA, Dallas, Sydney, Auckland, London and Waterford, Ireland. Humble brag: In 2024, Kargo was recognized as a Best Place to Work by *Ad Age* and *Built In*.


**Who We Hire**



Success takes all kinds. Diversity describes our workforce. Inclusion defines our culture. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or other legally protected status. Individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment.


**Title: Administrative Assistant**


**Job Type: Full Time in Office**  

  

**Job Location: New York, NY**  

  

**Salary Range:** 70,000 - 80,000 OTE


**The Opportunity**



Kargo is seeking a highly capable, polished and resourceful Administrative Assistant to support members of the Kargo Executive Team. Kargo's Administrative Assistant is part of the People Operations team and reports to the Chief of Staff. This role keeps the trains running on time at Kargo and provides all types of support with a positive, can-do attitude – no job is too big or too small. The AA must be professional, confident, adaptable and able to figure it out on the fly. This role provides a prime introduction to the world of advertising & media and for a candidate who hits it out of the park, is a stepping stone to their next role at the Company.


**The Daily To-Do**


* In-person role, reporting to the NYC office 5 days a week. Serve as the eyes and ears of the office, providing information, answering questions, and responding to requests.
* Welcomes all visitors, and guides them to the appropriate location to make them feel comfortable at the Kargo office.
* Manage the calendars of C-Suite members using Google Calendar. Schedules internal and external meetings for the Executive Team and keeps them on schedule.
* Coordinates domestic and international travel and hotel accommodations for the Executive Team pertaining to business travel only, using points and corporate programs to secure the best terms and pricing.
* Maintains Expensify to record monthly expenses.
* Prepare agendas for meetings and make arrangements, such as coordinating catering for in-person breakfast or lunches.
* Responsible for coverage when the Executive Assistant to the CEO is out of office.
* Retrieves information as requested from records, email, minutes, and other related documents; prepares written summaries of data when needed.
* Prepares plans and specifications for pickup/shipment, mailings, etc.
* Answer phones and direct callers to the appropriate point of contact.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


**Qualifications :**


* First-rate organizational skills. This individual needs to keep the Executive Team on schedule for any and all appointments.
* Confidentiality. You will be handling confidential tasks for members of our C-Suite. Discretion is key.
* Self-confidence and resilience. Must be able to think quickly, exercise sound judgment and course correct as necessary.
* Ability to multitask, prioritize, and sweat the details.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Must be available to work outside the standard 9-5 day.
* Proficiency in Google Suite, Microsoft Office, and Slack.


**Follow Our Lead**


* Big Picture: kargo.com
* The Latest: Instagram (@kargomobile) and LinkedIn (Kargo)

title: VP, Strategic Revenue Management
description:
**Who are we?**

  


Since 2004, KIND has been on a mission to create a kinder and healthier world - one snack and one act at a time. Its iconic KIND© bars - made with real, recognizable ingredients - sparked the growth of an entirely new healthy snacking category. Today, KIND has a family of more than 80 snacks that offer solutions for a variety of occasions. All of KIND's products lead with a nutrient-dense first ingredient - whole nuts, whole grains or whole fruit - and do not contain genetically engineered ingredients, sugar alcohols or artificial sweeteners.



Inspired by the belief that acts of kindness can be a transformative force for good, both the KIND brand and The KIND Foundation seek to inspire kindness and empathy.



We're looking for passionate collaborators to help us become the foremost leader in health & wellness and positively impact society along the way. If you're looking to be a part of an inspiring, energetic and entrepreneurial environment, you've found the right place.

**What you'll do**



We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Vice President of Strategic Revenue Management (SRM) to join our team and drive our revenue growth strategy.



As the Vice President of Strategic Revenue Management (SRM), you will spearhead our efforts in developing and integrating local revenue growth management capabilities. Your role will be pivotal in shaping our portfolio strategy and improving execution at the market level. You will champion best practices and serve as the center of excellence for Trade Promo Effectiveness, Strategic Pricing, Price Pack Architecture, and Trade Architecture.



Your key responsibilities will include:


* **Leadership & Integration:** Oversee all SRM activities to meet commitments related to Trade Promo Effectiveness, Strategic Pricing, Price Pack Architecture, and Trade Architecture.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Partner with Sales, Marketing, and Finance to enhance trade investment productivity and improve net pricing.
* **Performance Management:** Ensure effective SRM performance management processes are linked to Integrated Business Planning and Strategic Customer choices.
* **Process Optimization:** Develop robust processes for initiative dashboarding, KPIs, and market-level SRM capabilities.
* **Program Deployment:** Activate KIND NA programs and playbooks based on market needs and prioritization.
* **System Compliance:** Work with Sales Operations and Sales Finance to ensure TPM system compliance and data optimization.
* **Global Collaboration:** Partner with Mars Wrigley Global SRM team to share best practices and tools. Collaborate with Category Leadership and Customer Marketing to create compelling Retailer Value Propositions.
* **Team Development:** Recruit, retain, and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of career development and personal growth.


**What you'll bring to KIND**


* **Proven Experience:** A track record of translating strategies into actionable results, simplifying complex concepts, and delivering impactful outcomes.
* **Revenue Management Expertise:** Extensive functional and technical understanding of pricing, trade investment, and product mix management.
* **Commercial Acumen:** Strong financial and organizational skills with a deep understanding of P&L impacts and opportunities for improvement.
* **Analytical Skills:** Ability to navigate a fast-changing marketplace, make high-quality decisions, and drive continuous improvement.
* **Leadership:** Outstanding interpersonal skills with a passion for building and inspiring effective teams.
* **Commitment to Kindness:** A genuine desire to contribute to a kinder world through both professional and personal actions.


**You are...**


* **A Revenue Management Expert:** Proven ability to leverage insights into action and drive strategic initiatives.
* **A Strategic Partner:** Skilled at understanding and supporting corporate vision and collaborating with marketing teams.
* **An Agile Leader:** Able to navigate ambiguity and drive decision-making in a dynamic environment.
* **A Negotiator and Planner:** Experienced in negotiations and planning with a strong perspective.
* **A Developer of Talent:** Passionate about fostering team growth and professional development.
* **Kind at Heart:** Committed to spreading and celebrating kindness in every aspect of your role.


**You have...**


* **Experience:** At least 8 years in a blue-chip FMCG/consumer product environment with a strong analytical background in RGM/SRM, sales marketing or demand planning with specific emphasis within the North America market
* **Data-Driven:** Significant experience analyzing a range of internal and external data sources to form actionable insights.
* **Matrix Management:** Proven ability to navigate and succeed in a multinational matrix business environment.


**Pluses**


* An MBA or master's in finance or a related field is strongly preferred.
* Relevant experience in SRM, sales marketing and or demand planning specifically in the North American market


* ***This position is a hybrid position combining both in-office and remote work.***



Certain states and localities require employers to post a reasonable estimate of salary range. A reasonable estimate of the current base salary range for this position is **$191,000.00 - $257,000.00**. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors, including location, experience, skill set, performance, licensure and certification, and business needs. The range for this position in other geographic locations may differ.

#LI-Hybrid

**What KIND offers...**



KIND provides a robust benefits package to help support you physically, financially, and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.


* Competitive salary, including a target bonus and an impressive benefits package!
* Flexible Paid Time Off. Choose what works best for you, including summer hours
* Excellent health, dental & vision insurance, with options to fit you & your family's needs
* Your health is important! Our wellness strategy focuses on mental and physical well-being through in office programs like Drs, Nutritionists, Mindfulness, Chair Massages & others
* Casual office dress code - feel free to wear your KIND gear
* Stock up on your favorite KIND bars to share with your family & friends, through a quarterly voucher
* Training & tuition reimbursement program, because continuing to learn matters and we support your development
* A dynamic, ambitious, fun and KIND work environment
* The opportunity and responsibility to be KIND everyday

  


**EEO**



At KIND, we are committed to an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is championed. KIND is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we are an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.

  


**Privacy Policy**



KIND promises that our products will always lead with a nutrient-dense first ingredient, such as nuts, whole grains or fruit – a disruptive notion that sparked the creation of a new healthy snacking category. We aim to challenge the status quo within the food industry and empower our community to make better, informed choices about health. To view KIND's Privacy Policy in its entirety please follow this link: https://www.kindsnacks.com/privacy-policy.html



To view your privacy choices please follow this link.

title: Clinical Lab Instructor - Part-time
description:
Orbis Education has partnered with Felician University by offering an Accelerated Bachelor of Science in Nursing Program. Students complete theory via online learning, nursing skills in the lab and simulation environment and complete their clinical rotations in the Northern NJ area. We are seeking a full-time instructor to oversee students in the skills and simulation labs. As Clinical Lab Instructor, the primary responsibility is the implementation of the academic programs.
Who is Orbis Education? Orbis partners with colleges and universities to expand their pre-licensure healthcare programs. Our partners leverage our expertise to produce thousands of high-quality graduates ready to enter the workforce and meet employers’ demands
What You Will Do:* Facilitate effective student learning in the clinical/lab setting and via the online learning environment
* Provide adequate guidance for students in the clinical/lab setting related to professionalism, practice, and research
* Collaborate effectively with the Healthcare Partner and its staff and support clinical adjunct faculty when needed
* Maintain and Teach Nursing Knowledge Maintain current knowledge of the extended campuses Nursing curriculum, policies, and requirements
* Maintains clinical competence and knowledge in area of expertise


What You Will Have:* An ability to develop, support and maintain positive working relationships with colleagues, students, and adjunct clinical faculty
* Evidence of two years of successful professional nursing practice.
* Evidence of two years of teaching experience (preferred). Ability to provide a supportive learning environment for students
* Experience working in a simulation environment with high and low fidelity mannequins a plus
* Confidence with AV equipment, learning management platforms and student database systems
* Bachelor's degree in nursing is required
* NJ RN licensure
* Additional ongoing certifications and training desired


What we’ll offer in return:* A career where your work genuinely makes a difference
* A stable income with a good salary
* Extensive training with team and management support
* Structured professional development plans and opportunities
* Outstanding benefits and work perks
* Collaborative and supportive team environment...and more!

title: Influencer Marketing Manager (Creative Production)
description:
**Excel Sports Management** is an industry-leading sports agency representing top-tier talent, blue-chip brands and marquee properties. Our success is rooted in our people, our high character reputation and our commitment to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace. We focus on team chemistry, collaboration, strong relationships, valuable networks, and ambitious ideas to deliver innovative solutions that keep our clients and agency ahead of the curve.

  


***Excel Sports Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).***



**Company Overview:**



Game Seven, an Excel Sports Management company, is a full service creative and experiential agency that lives for sport, music and culture. From the biggest moments to the smallest details, we pride ourselves on being in the know and building relationships that matter, for brands that matter.



Our team is comprised of creatives, strategists, producers, designers, account managers, influencer managers, filmmakers, volunteers, activists, ballplayers, hypebeasts, social media moguls, runners, mixologists, restaurant owners, party promoters, hip-hop elitists, show-bingers, hot-take havers, sneaker customizers, vintage t-shirt collectors, natural wine connoisseurs, fitness fanatics, wrestling fanatics, pet parents, plant parents, human parents, and general good time havers. Clients include Peloton, Nike, Spotify, Hennessy, Oakley, Meta, Instagram, TikTok, Timberland, Levi's, Blue Triton, Foot Locker, Jordan Brand, and more.


**Role Overview:**



The Influencer Marketing Manager's critical role is the day-to-day management of influencer, creator and talent programs for digital-focused, social campaigns and always-on creator ambassador programs. They will be responsible for delivering exemplary quality work on end-to-end influencer campaign management with little executive oversight and by collaborating with peers on their team. This includes working alongside the accounts and social teams to identify influencers, work through client feedback, negotiate and contract influencers, as well as thoughtfully and strategically reviewing content deliverables in order for influencer content to go live successfully upon hitting on all of the client's KPIs.



Overall critical thinking, problem-solving, and attention to detail, while taking the appropriate steps to address challenges/concerns, are all crucial to the success of this role. The Influencer Marketing Manager ensures that the agency is delivering innovative influencer output that matches overall client objectives and should have a keen understanding of social and digital content production, as well as a deep understanding of social media management, processes, and timelines.



**The Influencer Marketing Manager will be expected to oversee a multitude of tasks; including, but not limited to:**



* Maintain all assigned influencer projects and campaigns, ensuring both internal objectives and client objectives are being delivered upon, based on project briefs with a keen understanding of the various clients they're assigned to.
* Manage day-to-day execution of overlapping influencer campaigns, acting as the main point of contact for any and all influencer specific asks as it pertains to a client's needs. This includes, but is not limited to:
	+ Contributing to an influencer campaign strategy
	+ Sourcing influencers against an approved campaign strategy and taking client feedbackinto consideration and pivoting any influencer sourcing suggestions
	+ Drafting comms, briefs and contracts for influencers, as well as having timely andprofessional influencer negotiations
	+ Reviewing influencer content with a thoughtful and strategic eye, providing critical feedback, and ensuring all content hits on the requirements within a client brief before going live.
* Manage influencer-related budgets, as well as T&A and influencer-creative budgets within the overall project budget, and facilitating invoicing to Finance as necessary.
* Provide strategic and creative influencer support for client needs; displaying an understanding of challenges and opportunities while in turn assisting in developing solutions. Raising any implications of scope or budget constraints to the Director of Influencer Marketing and applicable Accounts team.


**Requirements:**



* 3-5 years of influencer management campaign/program experience within an agency environment (previous roles can include influencer marketing coordinator and manager).Strong understanding of how influencer campaigns work and can be executed. You will be the last line of review before any influencer work goes to the client, this is critical to client success.
* Ability to prioritize and manage 5 to 8 influencer campaigns simultaneously for various clients with varying budgets.
* Excellent communication and organization skills supported by a high level of professionalism and efficiency.
* Ability to think on your toes and pivot when information from the client is scarce.
* Skilled expository writing and oral presentation skills.
* Experience with budget tracking and negotiations as it pertains to influencer contracting.
* Fluent in influencer contracting legalese and best practices.
* Existing talent relationships within the digital and traditional media spaces.
* Strong understanding of FTC guidelines and required disclosures.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced, detail-driven environment with tight deadlines.
* Highly competent with Asana, Google Suite, Microsoft Office, Apple products and software, and Box/Dropbox.


**The pay range for this position is $90,000 - $100,000 per year. This position is also eligible for benefits and discretionary bonus.**


**Please note that the foregoing compensation information is a good-faith assessment associated with this position only and is provided pursuant to the New York City Salary Transparency Law.**


**Ultimately, the salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience, time in role, business sector, and geographic location, among other criteria.**

**This position is not eligible for sponsorship.**

  


*Excel Sports Management provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*
